div.l: Out at the dore he goth ful pryuely
Whan that he saugh his tyme softely
He loketh vp and doun til he hath founde
The clerkes hors ther as it stood y bounde
By hynde the Mille vnder a lefselle
And to the hors goth hym fayre and wel
He streepeth of the bridel right a non
And whan the hors was laus he gynneth gon
To ward the fen ther wilde mares renne
And forth with we hee thurgh thikke and thurgh thenne
This Millere goth a gayn no word he seide
But doth his note and with the clerkes pleide
Til that hir corn was faire and wel y grounde
And whan the mele is sakked and y bounde
This Iohn gooth out and fynt his hors away
An gan to crie harrowe and wailleway
Oure hors is lost Aleyn for godes banes
Stap on thi feet come out man al at anes
Allas oure warden hath his palfray lorn
This Aleyn al for gat bothe mele and corn
Al was out of his mynde his hosbandrie
What whilke way is he gon he gan to crie
div.note: Pen trials in a later hand in right margin to line 162.
div.l: The wif cam lepyng Inward with a ren
She seide allas youre hors goth to the fen
With wilde mares as faste as he may go
Vn thank come on his hand that band hym so
And that beter shold haue knet the reyne
Allas quod Iohn Aleyn for cristes peyne
Lay doun thi swerd and I shal myn alswa
I is ful wight god waat as is a Ra
Bi goddes hert he shal nat scape vs bathe
Whi ne had thow put the capel in the lathe
Ilhaal Aleyn by god thow is a fonne
This sely clerkes han ful faste y ronne
